item.title: Bullying
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Fails:

Words hurt, words kill, whether you want to believe it or not. Some people can’t take the emotional torture, that’s my whole point. I have seen comments such as “you should rage quit life right now” I mean, who the fuck says that to someone? Internet or not. It shouldn’t be tolerated whatsoever. You have no clue what people go through, regarding real life issues.

Words only hurt if you let them hurt, and I learned to drown out any abuse that was thrown at me over time. In my own opinion, public schools should teach their students that words don’t hurt you unless you let them.

This doesn’t justify bullying, clearly, it’s a terrible thing. I was bullied pretty much until freshman year of high school and then I finally came to my standpoint that you can say whatever the hell you want about me, I’m more than likely going to end off better than you if you get your kicks of torture.

Fails:

Also, one can not simply quit using the internet, so telling people who can’t ‘handle’ it to stay off isn’t even ‘fair’, to say the least. It isn’t them who needs to stay off, it’s the immature bullies. If they aren’t mature enough to respect everyone, they’re not mature enough to use such a tool (in this case, the internet). Half the e-bullies are probably insecure about themselves so they must take it out on someone (internet or real life) that is weaker than them, physically and emotionally.

Despite this fact, no one can take away their ability to use their own personal computer or the internet as there’s no set rule on what each person considers bullying and what each person can take. It would also end up with people doing the ‘finger pointing’ game and saying “x told me to fuck off, ban him” even though the reporter attacked him first.

My point is that it’s not something that’s stoppable, it will always exist because not all people can co-exist peacefully. No matter how terrible it is or may become, there’s no way to really enforce any set laws on bullying properly, especially over the internet where people are from multiple countries.

item.title: Bullying
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Bullying works the same way real life and on the internet. They usually target the individual’s insecurities. The difference between bullying on the internet and in the real world is that they cannot harm you physically online. People have different insecurities and different tolerances to what they can take. I personally wish that nobody would bully online or in the real world, as neither is healthy or morally correct. However, I understand Taharok’s stand on this topic. This isn’t a daycare, and he simply cannot punish people for bullying. Albeit, it would surely be nice (as David said) if he (or anyone else for that matter) saw someone being bullied on #mopar or whatever and sent them a private message and said something like, “Hey don’t take it personal. They are just messing with you. Just ignore them and act yourself. Don’t brag or lie about awesome you are, just have a normal conversation. If you still don’t fit in, then perhaps you should just stay away from #mopar, as not everyone meshes with everybody”.

Also as David said, those guys may just be messing around and the other individual takes it personally and as bullying because of low self esteem and insecurities.
